Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style large chalice or heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown; exterior: near bottom of sherd, two brown lines above tip of rising ray.
Curator's comments: The rising ray is a motif commonly found in the Wild Goat Style but it disappears with the end of that style; however, the lower body of Wild Goat Style chalices is normally more heavily decorated. The size of the sherd suggests that it most likely comes from a heavy chalice, a shape that was introduced with the Mature Animal Style. The wall decoration of Mature Animal Style chalices is more restrained than that on Wild Goat Style chalices. Therefore, this vessel may belong to the transition from Wild Goat to Mature Animal Style. Perhaps from same chalice as 1965,0930.265.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1335) (phase 2)
